sentence.text: The 15-inch display is absolutely stunning with vibrant colors that make my photos pop.
I was surprised that the battery lasted nearly 12 hours during my flight across the country.
The keys have a satisfying travel that makes typing long reports actually enjoyable.
It is surprisingly lightweight for its size, fitting easily into my carry-on bag.
so i finally upgraded my rig and honestly the graphics card is a total beast for gaming.
the fans get pretty loud when i'm playing cyberpunk but they keep the temps low.
i love how smooth the 144hz screen feels during fast-paced matches.
the 1tb ssd is fast enough that loading screens are basically non-existent.
Where do I even begin with this nightmare of a machine?
The trackpad is SO frustrating because it registers ghost clicks every few minutes.
I tried calling technical support but the wait times were over an hour long.
The build quality feels like cheap plastic that might crack if I breathe on it wrong.
Man, this thing is just plain slow.
The processor chugs just trying to open more than three tabs in Chrome.
only having 8gb of ram in 2024 is a complete joke for this price.
I should have spent the extra money on a better model.
Bought this for college and the portability is definitely the best feature.
It's so light that I barely notice it in my backpack walking across campus.
The webcam is okay for Zoom classes, though the image is a bit grainy in low light.
Battery life gets me through most of the day without needing my charger.
Heads up, the port selection on this laptop is absolutely miserable.
I had to buy a separate dongle just to plug in a simple mouse and my monitor.
The lack of an HDMI port is a huge oversight for business presentations.
At least the chassis feels sturdy and well-constructed.
Coming from a MacBook, the Windows interface took some getting used to but it's fine.
the hardware is actually very impressive for the cost.
the keyboard has a nice bounce to it which i really appreciate.
but the speakers are pretty tinny and lack any real bass.
First day with this new machine and the setup was a total breeze.
I love the sleek finish and the way the lid opens with just one finger.
The screen is bright enough to use outside on my patio which is a huge plus.
Traded in my old Dell for this and I am blown away by the speed.
Everything loads instantly thanks to the NVMe drive inside.
The 16GB RAM handles all my multitasking without any stuttering at all.
It's the best investment I've made for my home office this year.
Ok so the laptop looks cool but it keeps crashing whenever I run Photoshop.
i think there is a problem with the motherboard or the drivers.
customer service was useless and just told me to reset the whole thing.
waste of money if you ask me.
Three weeks in and the power brick already stopped working.
The laptop won't even turn on now and I'm stuck with a dead battery.
I am beyond frustrated with the quality control of this company.
Avoid this model if you need something reliable for work.
If you're looking for a solid professional laptop, this is a great choice.
The keyboard is one of the best I've ever used on a mobile workstation.
Screen resolution is crisp and the matte finish prevents annoying glares.
It's a bit pricey but the performance justifies every penny.
Mixed feelings about the new touch bar feature on this model.
It looks cool but it's not as functional as actual physical buttons.
The battery life is decent, getting about 7 hours of web browsing.
Overall it's a solid machine but maybe wait for a sale.
Alright, the shipping was super fast and it arrived in perfect condition.
The unboxing experience was premium and the laptop itself feels very high-end.
The metal casing is much nicer than the plastic ones on cheaper brands.
Very happy with my purchase so far!
256GB felt limiting so I had to upgrade the internal storage immediately.
the screws on the bottom were tiny and hard to remove without stripping them.
once i got inside the layout was pretty clean for a modern laptop.
I wanted to love this but the screen flicker is driving me crazy.
Every time I watch a video, the display just glitches out for a second.
The warranty process is a nightmare and they want me to pay for shipping.
Never buying from this brand again.
Used this daily for 3 months and the battery life has already dropped significantly.
i used to get 8 hours and now i'm lucky to get 4.
the trackpad also started sticking which makes it hard to navigate.
really disappointed in the longevity of this device.
The speakers are AMAZING and provide a really immersive sound for movies.
I was shocked at how loud and clear they are for such a thin laptop.
The display is also gorgeous with deep blacks and great contrast.
It's the perfect machine for media consumption.
Why didn't I switch sooner to this incredible laptop?
The keyboard feels like a dream and my typing speed has actually increased.
The software is clean without any of that annoying bloatware.
After two months of heavy use, the hinges are starting to feel a bit loose.
It's a shame because the performance is still top-notch for video editing.
The i7 chip inside handles high-res exports without breaking a sweat.
The screen is color accurate which is vital for my creative work.
The 15-inch display is absolutely stunning with its deep blacks and vibrant colors.
I can easily get through a whole workday because the battery life lasts a solid 12 hours.
The keyboard has great travel, making it a dream for my long coding sessions.
Plus, the sleek aluminum chassis feels incredibly premium and sturdy.
Three weeks in and I'm already regretting this purchase because the fan noise is UNBEARABLE.
Every time I open Chrome, the processor seems to struggle and the bottom gets hot.
The trackpad is also super glitchy and barely registers my clicks half the time.
I really expected better performance for a machine that cost me over $1200.
Where do I even begin?
This laptop is a powerhouse for video editing thanks to the 32GB RAM and dedicated graphics.
Rendering 4K files is super fast, and the screen is color-accurate right out of the box.
It handles heavy workloads without any lag, which is exactly what I needed for my studio.
honestly this laptop is pretty solid. i use it every day and the keyboard feels great.
the battery lasts about 8 hours which is plenty for my classes.
it's thin and light so it fits in my backpack perfectly.
i haven't had any issues with the software or anything yet.
Fair warning to anyone buying this: the webcam is absolutely terrible.
The 720p resolution looks grainy even in a well-lit room, which is embarrassing for Zoom calls.
Also, the built-in speakers sound tinny and lack any kind of bass.
I had to buy an external headset just to hear people clearly during meetings.
Bought this for college and it's been a lifesaver for taking notes.
The 13" size is just right for those tiny lecture hall desks.
It boots up in seconds because of the SSD, which is a huge upgrade from my old clunker.
I love the backlit keyboard for late-night study sessions in the library.
Traded in my old Dell for this and the difference in build quality is night and day.
The hinge feels very sturdy and the screen doesn't wobble at all when I'm typing.
Windows 11 runs incredibly smooth on this hardware without any bloatware.
It's definitely worth every penny for a professional work setup.
so i picked this up last week. The screen is decent but the speakers kinda suck.
it's fast enough for browsing and youtube, but the battery dies way faster than advertised.
The trackpad is huge which is nice, but it clicks really loudly.
might return it if i can't get used to the noise.
The battery life is AMAZING but the trackpad is SO frustrating to use.
It jumps all over the place when I'm trying to select text.
I love the screen brightness though, it's CRITICAL for working outside.
If they fixed the mouse issues, this would be a PERFECT machine.
Man, I am so disappointed with the customer support from this company.
My laptop arrived with a dead pixel on the monitor and they won't replace it.
I've spent hours on the phone and keep getting disconnected.
The hardware feels cheap for a $900 device and I keep having wifi drops.
Used this daily for 3 months and the keyboard is already falling apart.
Two of the keys popped off and the spacebar feels mushy and unresponsive.
The internal storage is also much slower than the advertised specs suggest.
I expected a lot more durability for the price I paid.
If you're looking for a gaming rig, the RTX graphics card in this is a beast.
I can play Cyberpunk on high settings with a consistently high frame rate.
The cooling system actually works well and keeps the temps down during long gaming sessions.
The 144Hz refresh rate on the screen makes everything look incredibly fluid.
Alright, the port selection on this thing is a total joke.
Only one USB-C port means I have to carry a dongle everywhere I go.
The battery charger is also huge and bulky, which ruins the portability.
It's a shame because the display is actually quite nice for the money.
i wanted to love this but the software comes with so much bloatware i had to reinstall windows.
the actual hardware is nice, especially the metal body and the bright screen.
but the setup process took hours because of all the updates and junk apps.
once it's clean it runs okay, but i shouldn't have to do that for a new laptop.
Mixed feelings about the 512 gigs of storage because it filled up so fast.
The read speeds are great, but you'll definitely need an external drive for games.
The RAM is soldered too, so you can't even upgrade it later which is a bummer.
Overall it's a decent mid-range laptop despite these limitations.
First day with this and the power supply already failed on me.
The laptop won't charge at all, and I've tried multiple outlets in my house.
I called support and they said it would take two weeks to send a replacement cable.
This is completely unacceptable for a brand new device.
Coming from a MacBook, the trackpad on this Windows machine is surprisingly good.
The gestures are smooth and the surface feels very similar to what I'm used to.
I'm also impressed by the battery life which gets me through a full day of meetings.
It's a great alternative if you want to save some money without sacrificing quality.
256GB felt limiting so I was worried, but the cloud integration works well.
The performance is snappy for office work and the keyboard is very quiet.
I love how portable it is for traveling; it's so light I barely notice it in my bag.
Overall, a solid choice for business travelers.
Ok so... the screen resolution is just not what I expected for this price point.
Colors look washed out and the viewing angles are pretty narrow.
The i5 processor is decent for basic tasks but it gets noisy under load.
I think there are better options out there if you care about the display quality.
So I finally upgraded my old laptop and wow, this thing is fast!
The 16 gigs of ram makes multitasking a breeze, even with fifty tabs open.
The speakers are SURPRISINGLY LOUD and clear for such a small device.
Everything about the hardware feels high-end and I am very happy with it.
The 15-inch display is absolutely stunning with its deep blacks and vibrant colors.
I can easily get through a whole workday because the battery lasts about 11 hours on a single charge.
The keyboard feels very tactile and responsive for my long coding sessions.
Overall, this mbp is a beast for any creative professional.
man, i really wanted to like this thing but the fans are SO LOUD.
even when i'm just browsing the web, the bottom gets hot enough to burn my legs.
the 8gb of ram just isn't enough for modern apps anymore and it stutters constantly.
the build quality feels cheap and plasticky for a machine that cost me 800 bucks.
So I finally upgraded to this new model and the trackpad is just massive and smooth.
It handles 4K video editing without any lag thanks to the powerful processor inside.
The ports are a bit limited though, so I have to carry a dongle everywhere.
Still, the portability makes it perfect for my remote work lifestyle.
Where do I even begin with this disaster of a laptop?
The screen arrived with three dead pixels right in the center of the display.
I tried calling technical support but I was on hold for two hours with no resolution.
Shipping was fast, but that doesn't matter if the product is defective.
Save your money and buy literally anything else.
honestly, this chromebook is a total life saver for my classes.
it's super lightweight so i can toss it in my backpack and barely feel it.
the webcam is actually decent for zoom calls which was a nice surprise.
the speakers are pretty tinny but for 200 dollars i can't complain much.
Bought this for college and the battery life is truly TERRIBLE.
I can only get about 3 hours of use before it dies during my lectures.
The charger is also really bulky and heavy to carry around all day.
Plus the software keeps crashing whenever I open more than three tabs.
For anyone considering this gaming rig, the graphics card is a beast.
I'm getting over 100 FPS on high settings in every game I play.
The cooling system works great and keeps the GPU temps low.
The only downside is that the keyboard backlight is a bit dim.
Heads up, the 256GB SSD fills up way faster than you would expect.
After installing Windows and a few work apps, I only had half the space left.
The drive speeds are fast, but the capacity is just not sufficient for 2024.
I had to buy an external hard drive just to store my photos.
Traded in my old Dell for this and the difference in screen quality is night and day.
The brightness is incredible, even when I'm working outside on the patio.
Everything looks so crisp and the bezels are super thin.
It's the best display I've ever used on a portable machine.
Alright, the hardware is solid but the operating system is a mess.
i keep getting these random blue screens of death when i try to wake it from sleep.
updates take forever to install and usually break my printer drivers.
it's a shame because the actual laptop feels so well built.
Mixed feelings about this one as the keyboard is fantastic but the hinge feels weak.
The screen wobbles every time I type which is really distracting.
Performance is snappy for office work with the 16gb memory.
I just worry about how long the physical build will actually last.
Used this daily for 3 months and the battery has already degraded significantly.
I'm only getting half the runtime I did when it was brand new.
The manufacturer support was useless and told me it was normal wear and tear.
I definitely wouldn't buy from this company again.
First day with this and I'm blown away by how fast it boots up.
The SSD is lightning quick and apps open almost instantly.
I love the sleek aluminum design and the space gray color looks professional.
The setup process was a breeze and everything just worked out of the box.
Why didn't I switch sooner to this laptop for my business trips?
It's so thin that it fits perfectly on those tiny airplane trays.
The keyboard is quiet enough that I don't bother the person sitting next to me.
The Wi-Fi connectivity is rock solid even in patchy hotel networks.
Three weeks in and the trackpad has stopped clicking entirely.
I have to use an external mouse now which ruins the whole point of a laptop.
The warranty process is a nightmare and they want me to pay for shipping.
The quality control at this brand is just non-existent.
If you're looking for a budget machine, this is a decent choice for the price.
The screen isn't the brightest but it's fine for indoor use and netflix.
Battery life is okay, usually giving me around 6 hours of web surfing.
The plastic chassis feels a little flimsy but it's what you'd expect for 400 bucks.
Absolutely love the touchscreen functionality on this 2-in-1 device.
It makes scrolling through long articles and signing documents so much easier.
The colors on the display are vibrant and very accurate for my photo editing.
Plus the facial recognition for logging in is super fast and convenient.
Look, the performance is great but the bloatware is absolutely RIDICULOUS.
it took me two hours just to uninstall all the junk apps that came pre-installed.
once i cleaned it up, the cpu really started to shine in benchmarks.
the hardware is five stars but the software experience is a one.
Man, the speakers on this thing are honestly the best I've ever heard.
The sound is rich and has actual bass, which is rare for a laptop.
I don't even need to use my headphones when I'm watching movies in my room.
The screen matches the audio quality with its amazing contrast and brightness.
256GB felt limiting so I opted for the 1TB model and it's worth every penny.
The read and write speeds are incredibly fast for transferring large files.
The keyboard has a lovely travel and the backlight is perfectly even.
I'm very happy with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone.
The 15-inch display is absolutely stunning with its vibrant colors and deep blacks.
I can easily get about 10 hours of use on a single charge while working remotely.
The build quality feels premium and it's surprisingly lightweight for its size.
I'm very happy with this purchase for my daily business needs.
so i picked this up last week for my cs classes.
the 16gb memory handles all my coding environments without any lag.
but the trackpad is weirdly stiff and hard to click sometimes.
overall the performance is great but the mouse feel is a letdown.
Where do I even begin with this disaster of a machine?
The cooling fans are LOUD even when I'm just browsing the web.
And the battery life is JOKE, lasting barely three hours.
I feel like I WASTED my money on this piece of junk.
Traded in my old Dell for this new gaming rig and it's a beast.
The graphics card delivers incredible frame rates on every title I've played.
Keyboard feels mechanical and very responsive during intense sessions.
honestly it's the best laptop i've ever owned.
fair warning to anyone buying this: the screen is really dim.
i tried using it outside and i couldn't see a thing.
the plastic casing also feels pretty cheap and flimsy in my hands.
it's just not worth the 800 dollars they are asking for.
Mixed feelings about this one after a month of use.
The processor is fast as lightning but the laptop gets really hot.
I love the sleek design features of the chassis.
However, the customer support was kind of rude when I called about the heat.
Bought this for college and it's been a lifesaver for my back.
it's only 3 lbs so carrying it across campus is no big deal.
battery lasts me through all my lectures without needing a plug.
the webcam is also super clear for my zoom calls with family.
Three weeks in and the hard drive already failed.
I lost all my work because of this unreliable hardware.
The company refused to pay for shipping for the repair.
Never buying from this brand again, complete waste of money.
For anyone considering this for video editing, just do it!
The rendering speeds on the 8-core CPU are just incredible.
I also love how many ports are available for my external drives.
The 1TB SSD is lightning fast and offers plenty of space.
Man, the speakers on this thing are absolute trash.
it sounds so tinny and quiet even at max volume.
the screen resolution is also pretty disappointing for the price.
i'm thinking about returning it tomorrow morning.
256G felt limiting so I had to upgrade the internal storage.
The laptop itself is quite snappy and the OS runs smoothly.
keyboard is decent enough for typing long emails.
overall a solid mid-range choice for home office work.
If you're looking for a professional-grade workstation, this is it.
The aluminum chassis is BEAUTIFUL and feels incredibly sturdy.
Connectivity is TOP-NOTCH with the latest Wi-Fi card included.
I haven't had a single issue with the software performance.
Ok so the trackpad keeps freezing every few minutes.
i tried updating the drivers but it didn't fix anything.
it's super frustrating when i'm trying to work on a deadline.
The motherboard might be faulty and i'm really annoyed.
First day with this mbp and I'm already in love.
The Retina display is crisp and makes my photos look amazing.
The keyboard feels great to type on, very tactile.
Everything about the design is just perfect.
Heads up, the power supply gets extremely hot while charging.
i'm worried it might melt something or start a fire.
the charging cord is also way too short for most desks.
customer service hasn't been helpful at all with my concerns.
Alright, this laptop is a decent value for the money.
The screen is okay, though the viewing angles could be better.
Battery life is about average, getting me around 6 hours.
It's a good basic machine for browsing and Netflix.
Used this daily for 3 months and the keyboard is failing.
Some keys just stop working randomly which is a total pain.
the fan is also starting to make a weird grinding noise.
i expected better quality for five hundred bucks.
I wanted to love this but the OS is just so buggy.
bloatware is everywhere and it slows down the whole system.
the trackpad feels cheap like it's made of thin plastic.
Honestly, I'm thinking of switching back to my old Mac.
So I finally upgraded to this model and it's life-changing.
The facial recognition works every time and is so convenient.
I love the backlit keyboard for working late at night.
The battery life is AMAZING and easily lasts a full day.
Why didn't I switch sooner to this lightweight masterpiece?
The screen colors are so vibrant it makes editing photos a joy.
it's super fast and the 16 gigs of ram handles everything.
The build is solid and the hinges feel very durable.
The 15-inch display is absolutely stunning with its deep blacks and vibrant colors.
I can easily get about 10 hours of use on a single charge while working in the office.
The keyboard feels very tactile and responsive for long typing sessions.
Overall, this is a fantastic machine for any creative professional.
honestly this laptop is pretty solid.
i use it every day for school and the keyboard feels great.
the trackpad is super smooth too.
only issue is the webcam is kinda grainy in low light.
Three weeks in and I'm already seeing blue screen errors constantly.
The cooling fans are LOUD even when I'm just browsing the web.
It gets really hot on my lap which is super uncomfortable.
I really regret spending $1200 on this piece of junk.
Where do I even begin with this disaster?
The battery life is TERRIBLE and barely lasts 2 hours.
The hinges feel flimsy like they're going to snap off any second.
Tech support was no help at all when I called about the flickering screen.
Picked this up on Black Friday for my son's gaming needs.
The graphics card handles modern titles with no lag at all.
The 144Hz screen makes everything look incredibly smooth.
It's a bit heavy to carry around, but the performance is worth it.
Traded in my old Dell for this Macbook and the difference is night and day.
The build quality is just on another level compared to plastic laptops.
MacOS is so much more intuitive for my daily workflow.
Plus, the speakers are surprisingly loud and clear for a laptop.
so i picked this up last week. The screen is decent but the speakers kinda suck.
it's fast enough for browsing but i wouldn't try gaming on it.
the battery lasts me about 6 hours which is okay i guess.
For the price, it's a fine basic computer.
Man, this thing is a total powerhouse for my video editing.
The i9 processor and 32gb memory make rendering a breeze.
I love how many ports it has for all my external drives.
Even the trackpad is responsive enough that I don't always need a mouse.
Fair warning, the 256 gb storage fills up almost instantly.
The operating system takes up half the space before you even start.
Also, the charger cable is way too short for convenience.
I'm definitely returning this for something with better specs.
If you're looking for a lightweight travel companion, look elsewhere.
This 17" beast weighs a ton and doesn't fit in standard backpacks.
The screen quality is decent, but it's just not practical for commuting.
Battery life is also quite poor, lasting only four hours.
After two months, the keyboard started skipping letters like crazy.
i tried contacting support but they were totally useless.
then the wifi card just stopped working out of nowhere.
it's basically a very expensive paperweight now.
I wanted to love this but the software bloatware is insane.
It took me hours to uninstall all the junk programs pre-installed.
The hardware itself is actually pretty nice and well-built.
The display resolution is sharp and the colors are accurate.
Used this daily for 3 months for my remote IT job.
The 16 gigs of ram handles all my virtual machines without a hitch.
I'm really impressed with how cool the cpu stays under load.
The array of ports is great, especially having a dedicated ethernet.
Bought this for college and it's so incredibly light in my bag.
The battery life is AMAZING and gets me through a whole day of classes.
I love the sleek design and the silver finish looks so premium.
The only downside is the trackpad is SO small for my hands.
Heads up, the screen brightness is way too low for outdoor use.
i can barely see anything if there is any sunlight nearby.
the keyboard also feels a bit mushy compared to my old laptop.
it's a decent budget option but don't expect too much.
Alright, this thing is fast but the fan noise is just unbearable.
it sounds like a jet engine is taking off in my bedroom.
the screen is okay but it has some light bleed on the edges.
definitely not worth the five hundred bucks i paid.
First day with this and the trackpad is already sticking.
I can't click anything without it getting stuck down for seconds.
The shipping was fast but the product quality control is lacking.
I'm very disappointed in this purchase overall.
Why didn't I switch sooner to this amazing device?
The 1tb ssd is lightning fast and loads everything in seconds.
The keyboard is backlit and feels absolutely perfect to type on.
Best laptop I've ever owned, hands down.
256G felt limiting so I upgraded to a larger drive immediately.
the laptop case is pretty sturdy though and i like the matte finish.
the web cam is actually decent for zoom calls with my family.
Overall a good middle-of-the-road choice for a casual user.
Coming from a MacBook, the screen on this thing is a huge letdown.
The viewing angles are poor and the colors look washed out.
Also, the trackpad feels cheap and clicks very loudly.
I'm returning it because it's just not worth the money.
The 15-inch display is absolutely stunning with its deep blacks and vibrant colors.
I can easily get through a full workday because the battery life lasts a solid 10 hours.
The keys have great travel and the keyboard feels very premium for typing long reports.
It handles all my professional software without any lag or stuttering.
so i finally upgraded to this new mbp and honestly it's a mixed bag.
the screen is super bright and clear which i love for editing photos.
but the ports are so limited i have to carry a dongle everywhere.
the trackpad is huge and responsive though so that's a plus.
Where do I even begin with this absolute disaster of a machine?
The CPU gets UNBELIEVABLY HOT even when I'm just browsing the web with a few tabs open.
Because it overheats, the fans are CONSTANTLY LOUD and sound like a jet taking off.
I am so disappointed in the build quality of this expensive laptop.
Picked this up on Black Friday for my daughter's remote schoolwork and it's been perfect.
Setting up the windows os was a breeze and very intuitive for her to use.
The built-in webcam has a surprisingly sharp picture for her zoom classes.
For the price we paid, we really couldn't have asked for a better deal.
Heads up to any gamers, this thing throttles like crazy after twenty minutes.
The graphics card just can't keep up with modern titles at high settings.
Even with 16gb memory, the system feels sluggish when multitasking during a stream.
I'm definitely returning this and going back to my desktop setup.
Man, this laptop is sleek and so easy to carry around in my backpack.
The aluminum chassis feels incredibly sturdy and well-made.
Battery life is decent enough, getting me through most of the day at the library.
Definitely a solid choice for a college student who is always on the move.
Three weeks in and the hard drive has already failed on me twice.
I tried calling customer support but they were absolutely useless and kept transferring me.
The technical service they provided didn't even fix the underlying boot issues.
Do not buy from this brand if you value your time and data.
If you're looking for a beast for video editing, this i7 processor is the real deal.
Render times are incredibly fast compared to my old dual-core machine.
The 512 gb storage is fast, though I wish it had a bit more space for raw footage.
Overall, the performance is top-notch for creative professionals.
256GB felt limiting from the start so I had to upgrade the internal drive immediately.
Also, the wifi connectivity is spotty and drops out whenever I move rooms.
The trackpad clicks feel cheap and sometimes it doesn't even register my taps.
For a mid-range laptop, I expected much better hardware quality than this.
Alright, let's talk about the speakers because they are honestly fantastic.
I was shocked at how much bass and clarity they have for a thin notebook.
Watching movies is a joy on this 4k screen with such great audio quality.
It's the perfect media machine for my bedroom.
honestly this laptop is pretty solid. i use it every day and the keyboard feels great.
the battery lasts a long time and i don't even carry the charger with me.
the only downside is the glossy screen reflects everything in my office.
but for the price it's a great little computer for work.
Traded in my old Dell and the difference in weight is incredible.
This new model is under 3 lbs and fits perfectly on airplane trays.
The keyboard backlighting is very helpful for working during night flights.
I travel a lot for business and this is exactly what I needed.
Fair warning, the software that comes pre-installed is a total mess.
There is so much bloatware slowing down the boot time and eating up resources.
The motherboard seems to have issues with the usb ports too.
I had to spend four hours just cleaning up the os to make it usable.
Mixed feelings about this purchase after using it for a month.
The hardware performance is great for gaming, but the screen colors feel a bit washed out.
The cooling system is effective, but it makes a high-pitched whining noise.
It's a powerful machine, but definitely has some annoying quirks.
First day with this and the charger stopped working out of the box.
The power supply gets EXTREMELY HOT even when the laptop is just sitting there.
Contacted the company for a replacement and they want me to pay for shipping.
This is terrible service for a brand-new product.
Why didn't I switch sooner to this amazing device?
The battery performance is just incredible, I get about 12 hours of use.
The touch pad is smooth as silk and much better than my old mouse.
Everything about the hardware feels like it was designed with care.
look, i'm not a tech expert but this laptop is just too slow.
it takes forever to open the browser and the windows updates take hours.
the screen is also really dim and hard to see if there's any light in the room.
i really regret buying this one and wish i spent more for something better.
Used this daily for 3 months as an IT pro and it's a solid workstation.
The 16 gigs of ram handles virtual machines without breaking a sweat.
I love that it has a dedicated ethernet port for stable connections.
The bios settings are easy to navigate and offer plenty of customization.
Absolutely love it, best purchase I've made all year!!
The screen resolution is crystal clear and makes my photos look AMAZING.
The keyboard is so quiet and comfortable for typing all night.
It's super light and the battery lasts FOREVER on a single charge.
After two months, I've noticed the hinge is starting to creak whenever I open it.
The plastic lid feels kind of flimsy and flexes too much for my liking.
Also, the 128gb ssd is almost full already just from system updates.
I'm worried about the long-term durability of this hardware.
The 15-inch display is absolutely stunning with its deep blacks and vibrant colors.
I can easily get through a full workday because the battery life lasts a solid 12 hours.
The keyboard feels tactile and responsive, which makes typing long reports a breeze.
Overall, this is the best laptop I've owned for my remote office setup.
honestly this laptop is pretty solid. i use it every day and the keyboard feels great.
the screen is bright enough for working outside at the park.
i was worried about the 8gb memory being too low but it handles chrome tabs just fine.
for the price i paid, i really can't complain about the performance.
Where do I even begin with this disaster of a machine?
The trackpad is SO frustrating to use because it randomly clicks on things I didn't touch.
Also, the fans are CONSTANTLY loud even when I'm just browsing the web.
I'm extremely disappointed with the build quality considering how much I paid.
Bought this for college and it's been a total lifesaver for my zoom classes.
The webcam is actually decent quality compared to my old crappy laptop.
It fits perfectly in my backpack since it only weighs about 3 lbs.
battery lasts forever too, usually around 10 hours of heavy note taking.
Six months in and the motherboard just completely fried itself out of nowhere.
I tried calling customer support but they were useless and kept putting me on hold.
They told me the repair isn't covered under the standard warranty.
Never buying from this company again, absolutely terrible experience.
If you're looking for a beast for gaming, the RTX graphics card in this is insane.
The i9 processor handles every AAA title I throw at it without breaking a sweat.
However, the cooling system is quite loud when the fans kick in at full speed.
The 1TB SSD provides plenty of fast storage for all my huge game files.
So I finally upgraded to the new MacBook and the transition was surprisingly smooth.
The operating system is so intuitive and stable compared to my old Windows machine.
The trackpad is easily the gold standard for usability and gestures.
Only downside is the lack of ports which means I have to carry a dongle everywhere.
Traded in my old Dell for this model and I'm pretty let down by the screen.
The viewing angles are terrible and the colors look washed out.
Worst of all, the battery only lasts about 3 hours before needing a charge.
I definitely regret this purchase and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
Heads up, the wifi connection on this unit is extremely spotty.
It keeps dropping the signal in the middle of my work meetings.
I tried updating the software drivers but nothing seems to fix the issue.
The hardware just seems faulty and I'm going to return it for a refund.
Mixed feelings on this one because the design is beautiful but the performance is lacking.
The aluminum chassis feels very premium and sturdy in the hand.
However, the cpu gets throttled very quickly when running basic apps.
It's a decent machine for light office work but nothing more.
Man, the speakers on this thing are absolute garbage and sound like a tin can.
i can barely hear anything even when the volume is turned all the way up.
the screen resolution is also pretty disappointing for a 2024 model.
totally not worth the five hundred bucks i spent on it.
After two months of daily use, I can say the keyboard is the best I've ever used.
The keys have great travel and the backlighting is perfect for late night sessions.
Battery life is also impressive, easily lasting me around 9 hours.
I'm very satisfied with the overall hardware performance and reliability.
256G felt limiting so I ended up upgrading the internal storage myself.
The laptop design makes it surprisingly easy to open up and swap parts.
The processor is fast enough for my coding projects and virtual machines.
It's a solid choice for any IT professional who likes to tinkers.
Ok so the webcam on this thing is actually pretty decent for the price.
The screen is sharp and clear, making movies look great.
But the battery charging is SO SLOW, it takes like four hours to hit 100%.
Otherwise it's a great little machine for casual use at home.
First day with this and the trackpad is already sticking and clicking weirdly.
the build quality feels very cheap and plasticky for a premium brand.
it also gets super hot on the bottom after just twenty minutes of use.
i'm definitely not keeping this, going to exchange it for something better.
why didn't i switch sooner to this amazing ultrabook?
the 16gb memory makes multitasking between twenty different apps a breeze.
it's so lightweight that i barely even notice it in my bag during travel.
the battery life is honestly incredible, i get about 11 hours easily.
The laptop arrived in a beat up box and the screen was cracked.
Customer service was a nightmare to deal with for getting a replacement.
They tried to charge me for the shipping costs of the return.
Whole experience was a disaster and I'll never buy from this site again.
For anyone considering a new workstation, the graphics performance here is top-tier.
Rendering 4K video is lightning fast thanks to the dedicated GPU and 32GB RAM.
The display color accuracy is perfect for my professional photo editing work.
It's expensive but absolutely worth every penny for creative pros.
Used this daily for 3 months and the keyboard is already losing its lettering.
the keys feel mushy and sometimes they don't register my presses.
also the power adapter gets dangerously hot when it's plugged in.
overall just very poor quality for a laptop that cost nearly a thousand dollars.
I wanted to love this but the operating system is full of bloatware.
The pre-installed software slows down the boot time significantly.
The trackpad is okay but the gestures are not very responsive.

It is surprisingly lightweight, which is perfect for my daily commute.
honestly this laptop is pretty solid.

the trackpad is a bit small but it gets the job done for browsing.
shipping was fast and it arrived in perfect condition.

The internal fans are LOUD even when I'm just checking my email.

I tried calling support but they were completely unhelpful and rude.

The colors look washed out and the brightness is barely enough for a lit room.
Even though it has 16GB RAM, the software feels sluggish during multitasking.
I really regret spending $800 on this.
Man, this thing is a beast for gaming!
the graphics card handles everything i throw at it on ultra settings.
and the cooling system actually keeps the temps down during long sessions.
definitely worth every penny for a serious gamer.

I ran out of room after installing just a few apps and my photo library.

i use it for zoom calls and everyone says i look super clear.
the speakers are also pretty loud and don't distort at high volume.
it's a solid choice for anyone working from home.

The i7 processor is incredibly fast and handles my coding projects effortlessly.
The keyboard has a great layout and the keys have the perfect amount of travel.

Bought this for college but it stopped working after only two months.
The motherboard completely died and the repair cost is almost as much as a new one.

DO NOT waste your money on this brand.

The screen is bright and clear, which I love.

such a shame because the rest of the laptop is actually quite nice.

i love how thin it is, it's so easy to slide into my backpack.

it came loaded with so much bloatware that slowed everything down.
The 512 GB hard drive was already half full from the factory.

Also the power cord is way too short and won't reach my desk.
It's a shame because the build quality actually feels quite sturdy.
If you're looking for a budget machine, this is a solid choice for under $400.
The screen resolution isn't the best but it's fine for netflix.
it's mostly plastic but it doesn't feel like it's gonna break.

After two months, the screen just started flickering for no reason.
i tried to use the warranty but the company says it's physical damage.
I haven't even dropped it once so that is total garbage.
I'm so disappointed with the quality control on this expensive laptop.
I wanted to love this but the thermal throttling is just unbearable.
The processor slows down to a crawl whenever I try to do anything intensive.

Used this daily for 3 months as a software developer.
The keyboard feels great for coding and the keys have nice travel.

honestly i'm pretty impressed with this little chromebook.
the battery lasts forever, i only have to charge it every two days.
it's very light and fits perfectly on the small tray tables on planes.
for the price it's definitely a no-brainer for travelers.
The 256GB felt limiting so I had to buy an external drive.
THE PERFORMANCE IS FANTASTIC but the storage space is just too small.
the screen is bright enough for outdoor use which is a big plus.

I am beyond frustrated with this purchase.
Bought this for college and it's been a lifesaver for my back.
At only 3 lbs, it fits perfectly in my backpack without weighing me down.
The battery usually lasts about 8 hours, which gets me through most of my classes.
The price was a bit high for a student, but the quality makes it worth it.
256GB felt limiting so I should have definitely upgraded the storage.
The operating system takes up so much space right out of the box.
However, the windows interface is very snappy and easy to navigate.
First day with this new rig and the graphics are UNBELIEVABLE.
I'm running the latest games at ultra settings and getting a smooth 120 FPS.
The dedicated card is a beast for gaming.
It stays cool too, which I did NOT expect from such a thin laptop.
i wanted to love this but the keyboard is a nightmare.
keys keep sticking and i have to press them super hard to get a response.
the layout is also weirdly cramped for a 15" laptop.
i'm probably going to return it and get something else.
Man, the battery life on this mbp is just insane.
I can go two whole days without reaching for the power brick.
The screen brightness is also phenomenal, even when I'm working outside.
Best investment I've made for my freelance business.
Used this daily for 3 months and the software is super buggy.
It constantly freezes during updates and requires a hard reboot.
The pre-installed apps are basically bloatware that slows everything down.
I expected much better from a brand like this.
For anyone considering this for office work, the webcam is garbage.
The image is grainy and dark even in a well-lit room.
Also, the trackpad feels cheap and makes a loud hollow clicking sound.
I definitely regret not spending more on a higher-end model.
Alright, this laptop is a decent budget option for casual use.
the plastic build feels a bit flimsy but it keeps the weight down.
it runs web browsers and word documents without many issues.
don't expect to do any gaming though because the integrated graphics are weak.
So I finally upgraded to the new 14 inch model and I'm in love.
The display quality is lightyears ahead of my old machine.
Everything looks so crisp and the 120Hz refresh rate is buttery smooth.
It's the perfect size for someone who is always on the go.
Why didn't I switch sooner?
The keyboard is the best I've ever used on a portable computer.
The keys have just the right amount of travel for fast typing.
Plus, the battery lasts all day so I don't need my charger at work.
Mixed feelings about this one because while the screen is lovely, the wifi is TERRIBLE.
It keeps dropping the connection even when I'm sitting right next to the router.
The hardware looks great on paper but this wireless card issue is a dealbreaker.
Picked this up on Black Friday for five hundred bucks and it's a steal.
the 8gb ram is enough for my basic browsing and netflix habits.
shipping was super fast and it arrived in perfect condition.
very happy with this purchase so far.
After two months, the motherboard just died out of nowhere.
The laptop won't turn on at all, even when plugged into the power supply.
Customer service was a nightmare to deal with for the repair.
I would NOT recommend this brand to anyone looking for reliability.
The 15-inch display is absolutely stunning with its vibrant colors and deep blacks.
i've been using it for photo editing and the colors are spot on.
The keyboard feels very tactile and responsive during long typing sessions.
However, the battery life is pretty disappointing, only lasting about 4 hours.
So I finally upgraded to this new machine and wow, the speed is incredible!
Everything from booting up to opening heavy apps happens in an instant.
The build quality feels premium and sturdy in my hands.
It's definitely worth the price tag if you need a reliable workhorse.
Where do I even begin with this disaster of a laptop?
The fans are CONSTANTLY running loud even when I'm just browsing the web.
It gets SO HOT on my lap that it's actually uncomfortable to use.
I am seriously considering returning it tomorrow.
honestly this laptop is pretty solid. i use it every day and the keyboard feels great.
the trackpad is nice and wide which makes navigating easy.
it's super light too so i can toss it in my backpack without a problem.
great for a student on a budget.
Bought this for college and the 10-hour battery life has been a lifesaver.
I can go through all my lectures without hunting for a power outlet.
The screen resolution is sharp enough for Netflix during breaks.
Only downside is that the speakers sound a bit tinny.
Traded in my old Dell for this and the performance difference is night and day.
The 16GB RAM handles all my virtual machines without breaking a sweat.
Even the integrated graphics are decent for some light gaming on the side.
I'm very happy with this purchase.
Man, this webcam is absolutely terrible for a laptop at this price point.
The image is grainy and washed out during my Zoom meetings.
also the microphone picks up WAY too much background noise.
I expected much better quality from this brand.
Heads up, the 256GB storage fills up incredibly fast if you install games.
I had to buy an external drive within the first week.
Aside from that, the processor is super fast and snappy.
The wifi connection is also very stable throughout my house.
If you're looking for a beast for gaming, this is it right here!
The dedicated graphics card runs everything on ultra settings smoothly.
The 144Hz screen makes movement look buttery smooth.
It's a bit heavy to carry around but the power is worth it.
First day with this and the trackpad is SO frustrating to use.
It keeps misinterpreting my clicks and the gestures are hit or miss.
I might need to buy a separate mouse just to get work done.
The charging cable is also way too short for my desk setup.
I wanted to love this but the screen flickering is a dealbreaker.
It happens randomly every few minutes and it's very distracting.
I contacted support but they were not helpful at all.
Shipping was fast, but that doesn't matter if the product is defective.
Used this daily for 3 months and the keyboard is already failing.
The 'E' and 'R' keys stick constantly and won't register.
so frustrating for a laptop that cost over 1000 dollars.
i definitely wouldn't recommend this model to anyone.
Alright, the design of this thing is sleek and very modern looking.
The aluminum chassis feels sturdy and doesn't flex at all.
There are plenty of ports for all my peripherals which is rare nowadays.
The matte finish on the display helps a lot with glare.
Three weeks in and the software is already giving me headaches.
The pre-installed bloatware slows down the boot time significantly.
it's just a mess to try and clean everything out.
the operating system feels clunky with all these useless additions.
Mixed feelings about this one as the hardware is great but the OS is buggy.
The 16gb memory is plenty for multitasking between Chrome and Slack.
But it keeps crashing when I try to use the fingerprint sensor.
I'm hoping a future update fixes these stability issues.
Ok so the battery life on this mbp is just insane!
i can go a full two days without plugging it in for casual use.
the screen is super bright and crisp, even when i'm outside.
it's the best laptop i've ever owned, hands down.
Coming from a MacBook, the build quality of this plastic laptop is a joke.
The keyboard flexes when I type and the hinges feel very flimsy.
It feels like it's going to break if I drop it even an inch.
I am returning this immediately for a refund.
For anyone considering this for video editing, the rendering speed is top-notch.
The multi-core performance really shines when export times are cut in half.
The 1TB SSD is also very fast for moving large 4K files around.
It's a solid investment for any creative professional.
Fair warning, the speakers are located on the bottom and sound muffled.
If you use it on your lap, you can barely hear anything.
The webcam quality is also pretty poor for a modern machine.
I'd suggest looking at other options if audio is important to you.
Picked this up on Black Friday and it's been a great value for the money.
The setup was easy and the windows 11 interface is quite intuitive.
Battery gets me through about 7 hours of web browsing and docs.
The light weight makes it perfect for my daily commute.
